oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Accumulation of Dioxins and PCB in House Fly larvae (Musca domestica) reared in poultry manure and used in feed for organic laying hens
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Nordentoft, Steen
Cederberg, Tommy Licht
Fischer, Christian Holst
Bjerrum, Lotte
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Farming Systems
Animal husbandry
Environmental aspects
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Eggs from free range hens have frequently higher content of dioxins and PCB. As recycling manure may concentrate contaminants in the larvae, we tested whether larvae reared in poultry manure accumulated dioxins and PCB, and if feeding laying hens with these larvae would increase the levels of dioxins and PCB in the hen eggs.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Nordentoft, Steen; Cederberg, Tommy Licht; Fischer, Christian Holst and Bjerrum, Lotte (2014) Accumulation of Dioxins and PCB in House Fly larvae (Musca domestica) reared in poultry manure and used in feed for organic laying hens. Poster at: [Submitted]
